quote: If we desire respect for the law, we must first make the law respectable.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

quote: Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Ethics is knowing the difference between what you have a right to do and what is right to do.
author: Potter Stewart

quote: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Justice delayed is justice denied.
author: William E. Gladstone

quote: Laws are spider webs through which the big flies pass and the little ones get caught.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Make crime pay. Become a lawyer.
author: Will Rogers

quote: I have been committed to carrying out my duties... in accordance with both the letter and spirit of all applicable rules of ethics and canons of conduct.
author: Samuel Alito

quote: The safety of the people shall be the highest law.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Laws are like sausages, it is better not to see them being made.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: Justice is the sum of all moral duty.
author: William Godwin

quote: If the machine of government is of such a nature that it requires you to be the agent of injustice to another, then, I say, break the law.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: If you must break the law, do it to seize power: in all other cases observe it.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: It is better to risk saving a guilty man than to condemn an innocent one.
author: Voltaire

quote: Punishment is justice for the unjust.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: The best way to get a bad law repealed is to enforce it strictly.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Justice in the life and conduct of the State is possible only as first it resides in the hearts and souls of the citizens.
author: Plato

quote: Collecting more taxes than is absolutely necessary is legalized robbery.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: I busted a mirror and got seven years bad luck, but my lawyer thinks he can get me five.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Ignorance of the law excuses no man from practicing it.
author: Addison Mizner

quote: Law is born from despair of human nature.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: It is legal because I wish it.
author: Louis XIV

quote: The events of the day inspired me to become a lawyer.
author: Christopher Darden

quote: It is impossible to tell where the law stops and justice begins.
author: Arthur Baer

quote: Only one thing is impossible for God: To find any sense in any copyright law on the planet.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Common sense often makes good law.
author: William O. Douglas

quote: He is no lawyer who cannot take two sides.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Justice? You get justice in the next world, in this world you have the law.
author: William Gaddis

quote: A lean compromise is better than a fat lawsuit.
author: George Herbert

quote: People crushed by laws, have no hope but to evade power. If the laws are their enemies, they will be enemies to the law; and those who have most to hope and nothing to lose will always be dangerous.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Obedience to lawful authority is the foundation of manly character.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: Compromise is the best and cheapest lawyer.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: People do not win people fights. Lawyers do.
author: Norman Ralph Augustine

quote: I'm trusting in the Lord and a good lawyer.
author: Oliver North

quote: Laws made by common consent must not be trampled on by individuals.
author: George Washington

quote: Lawyers are the only persons in whom ignorance of the law is not punished.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: In the Halls of Justice the only justice is in the halls.
author: Lenny Bruce

quote: That which is not just is not law.
author: William Lloyd Garrison

quote: The trouble with law is lawyers.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: Advertising is legalized lying.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: One of the things I was taught in law school is that I'd never be able to think the same again - that being a lawyer is something that's part of who I am as an individual now.
author: Anita Hill

quote: Judges are the weakest link in our system of justice, and they are also the most protected.
author: Alan Dershowitz

quote: I say the law should be blind to race, gender and sexual orientation, just as it claims to be blind to wealth and power. There should be no specially protected groups of any kind, except for children, the severely disabled and the elderly, whose physical frailty demands society's care.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: A good lawyer is a bad Christian.
author: John Lothrop Motley

quote: In law, nothing is certain but the expense.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: A successful lawsuit is the one worn by a policeman.
author: Robert Frost

quote: If Moses had gone to Harvard Law School and spent three years working on the Hill, he would have written the Ten Commandments with three exceptions and a saving clause.
author: Charles Morgan

quote: All ambitions are lawful except those which climb upward on the miseries or credulities of mankind.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Lawyers are the first refuge of the incompetent.
author: Aaron Allston

quote: I decided I wanted to be a lawyer when I was 11 years of age.
author: Johnnie Cochran

quote: Lawyers spend a great deal of their time shoveling smoke.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: You can't learn everything you need to know legally.
author: John Irving

quote: I am the inferior of any man whose rights I trample under foot.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: A lawyer who does not know men is handicapped.
author: William Dunbar

quote: From your confessor, lawyer and physician, hide not your case on no condition.
author: John Harington

quote: Bad laws are the worst sort of tyranny.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Make your educational laws strict and your criminal ones can be gentle; but if you leave youth its liberty you will have to dig dungeons for ages.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: I would say that IQ is the strongest predictor of which field you can get into and hold a job in, whether you can be an accountant, lawyer or nurse, for example.
author: Daniel Goleman

quote: As a private lawyer, I could bill $750 an hour, but I don't.
author: Jay Alan Sekulow

quote: We are led by lawyers who do not understand either technology or balance sheets.
author: Thomas Friedman
